visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a chart with the following specifications: Chart type: area, Chart title: Cybertruck Chart, Axes and labels styling: x-axis categories are 'Front', 'Middle', 'Rear', y-axis is hidden with a minimum value of -0.5 and no start tick, Data series: 'Top' series with data points [0, 1], [0.85, 1.8], [2, 1] and color 'silver', 'Bottom' series with data points [1, 1, 1] and color 'gray', 'Wheel' series with scatter type, data points [0.3, 0], [1.7, 0], marker symbol 'circle' with radius 25 and color 'charcoal', 'Windows' series with data points [0.25, 1.1], [0.85, 1.65], [1.55, 1.2] and color '#666', 'Oops' series with data points [0.25, 1.1], [0.85, 1.65], [1.55, 1.2] and a pattern fill using an image, Custom colors: specified in each series, Additional configurations: chart height set to 50%, area plot options with line width 0 and disabled markers.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render an area chart titled 'Cybertruck Chart'. The x-axis is labeled with categories 'Front', 'Middle', and 'Rear', while the y-axis is hidden with a minimum value of -0.5 and no start tick. The chart includes five data series: 'Top' with silver color, 'Bottom' with gray color, 'Wheel' as a scatter plot with charcoal color and large circular markers, 'Windows' with a specific threshold and color, and 'Oops' with a pattern fill using an image. The area plot options disable markers and set the line width to 0. The chart's height is set to 50% of its container, ensuring it scales appropriately within the provided CSS constraints.
